newsitem.title: USA: CE Software sells interest in 4-Sight.
newsitem.headline: CE Software sells interest in 4-Sight.

text.p: CE Software Holdings Inc said Monday it sold its ownership interest in 4-Sight LC and estimated a gain on the sale of about $500,000 for the fourth quarter ending September 30.

The company said that 4 Sight Inc, a subsidiary of 4-Sight plc, will acquire CE Software's approximate 50 percent interest in U.S.-based 4-Sight LC for $250,000 in cash and the assumption of debt, payable to the company, in the amount of $1.4 million.

The company will be paid $467,000, one-third of the debt, concurrent with the closing on the sale of its ownership interest, effective August 31, with the remainder due in two equal installments of $467,000 to be paid December 31, 1996 and March 31, 1997, CE Software said.

"The divestiture of our ownership interest in 4-Sight LC is in keeping with our intentions to streamline operations and to focus our efforts on CE SOFTWARE's core revenue-producing products," said Richard Skeie, chief executive officer said.
